meta.content: Official Singles Chart on 24/12/2021 | Official Charts

content.title: Official Singles Chart on 24/12/2021
content.description: The Official UK Singles Chart reflects the UK’s biggest songs of the week, based on audio and video streams, downloads, CDs and vinyl, compiled by the Official Charts Company. The UK Top 40 is broadcast on BBC Radio 1, the Top 100 is published exclusively on OfficialCharts.com. View the biggest songs of 2024 so far.

drupalComments.title: a8661419-cf6b-4637-8612-f026e033f150
drupalComments.body:
Merry Christmas everyone!
Just something I've noticed on the Official Charts. Isn't Boney M's Mary's Boy Child/Oh My Lord a number one Hit? Here the song is referred as it peaked at number 26.

children.title: 334f9f3f-0eab-4ddf-b32d-8b807e475cb0
children.body:
yeah, it reached number 1 in 1978.

don’t know why occ got it wrong 😑

children.title: ec570f9b-3346-465d-a2dd-1e4eca4f1e1c
children.body:
Yes, there's several of the classic Christmas songs on this page that aren't attached to their initial chart runs, some for no good reason.

In Boney M's case, it's because the original 1978 chart entry is wrongly listed as just Mary's Boy Child. The modern chart runs are combined under an entry more correctly given as Mary's Boy Child/Oh My Lord. (Chart books like the Guinness British Hit Singles would in fact list it as Mary's Boy Child–Oh My Lord – it's a medley, not a double A-side.) But as a result, the system doesn't recognise it as being the same hit.

children.body:

drupalComments.title: 4e7cd9a5-0f01-4674-b3ad-b4a2d76f4c0b
drupalComments.body:
Some casual observations:

All the big old christmas hits have been higher and higher peaks as the streaming years go by.

The biggest of these hits seem to have reached as high as they will (Shaky / Pogues upwards)
The fact some of the consistent top 10s are now dropping during their re-entries is a particular indicator of this. In previous years they climbed wreek on week and dropped from their peak in NY week. As is teh fact multiple old songs are now getting to #1.

More and more old christmas songs continue to enter each year, also reaching higher and higher peaks, the highest are starting to easily hit the top 20 and challenge for top 10:
(Ronettes/Bobby Helms/Andy Williams/Chris Rea)

The same is true below the top 40, with even more christmas big hits of the physical era entering the first time in the digital era.

The lower hits reach their annual peak in New Year week (Streamed over Christmas Day itself), those with more established re-entries are starting to peak earlier (Mid-December to Christmas Week):

e.g. Pogues have been #7 for 3 weeks, Shaky dropping from #6, Mariah #1 mid December last year.

I wonder if we will continue to see old songs reach #1 as these more establish streaming hits start dropping, or if we will see a near 100% Christmas song week made up of 90%+ old songs.

drupalComments.body:
My Christmas Top 10!
10) Joel Corry x RAYE x David Guetta - BED (-4)
9) Ariana Grande - Santa Tell Me (RE) (new peak)
8) Wham - Last Christmas (+31)
7) LadBaby - I Love Sausage Rolls (RE) (my christmas number 1 of 2019)
6) Mariah Carey - All I Want For Christmas Is You (+4)
5) Becky Hill - Forever Young (RE) (new peak)
4) Griff - Love Is A Compass (RE) (new peak)
3) Joel Corry ft Mabel - I Wish (Christmas Version) (+26) (new peak)
2) The Pogues ft Kirsty MacColl - Fairytale of New York (+3) (new peak)
1) LadBaby ft Ed Sheeran & Elton John - Sausage Rolls For Everyone (NEW)
This also marks 4 consecutive Christmas number 1s for LadBaby on my chart, with the other two re-entering at 30 (Don’t Stop Me Eating) and 32 (We Built This City)
It was very close between LadBaby and The Pogues this week btw

drupalComments.title: 7a3c01a2-8dba-476a-915e-6d705669ea3a
drupalComments.body:
I have to ask, what’s been everyone’s favourite Christmas Number 1 over the years? :)

My personal choices for this would have to be:

1966: Tom Jones – Green Green Grass Of Home
1975: Queen – Bohemian Rhapsody
1984: Band Aid – Do They Know It’s Christmas?
1985: Shakin’ Stevens – Merry Christmas Everyone
1992: Whitney Houston – I Will Always Love You
1994: East 17 – Stay Another Day
2002: Girls Aloud – Sound Of The Underground
2006: Leona Lewis – A Moment Like This
2008: Alexandra Burke – Hallelujah
2013: Sam Bailey – Skyscraper

That would probably be my Top 10, but there have been so many from the past seven decades that this wasn’t an easy list to put together at all! 😂

children.title: 9d8daca8-59d7-4cb1-a12a-ec75b381ceee

1973: Slade - Merry Xmas Everybody
1979: Pink Floyd - Another Brick in the Wall Part. 2
2002: Girls Aloud - Sound Of The Underground
2009: Rage Against The Machine - Killing In The Name

Don’t really care for any others. 💀

drupalComments.title: 4e8ada88-cd10-40a6-aeb5-8cd0095d054f
drupalComments.body:
Hi!

Just coming in to tell y’all about our chart server.

Come join us to talk about the charts, music in general, and basically anything you want, I’m sure you’d all enjoy it. :)

Here’s the link (replace the * with a .)

https://discord*gg/QHjCVHt2Ep

Merry Christmas (or anything else you might be celebrating instead) everyone. :)

drupalComments.title: 4306a7ce-a9cb-47f7-8eb7-5e604d26a226
drupalComments.body:
LadBaby continuously raising money for food banks up & down the country is an incredible act of kindness, but that’s literally the only good thing I can say about his new song!

Thankfully, both today (Christmas Eve) & tomorrow (Christmas Day) will be counted towards the new tracking week, so hopefully we can still get a festive classic at #1 next week to round out the year, e.g. Mariah, Wham!, The Pogues, etc. :)

children.title: 82f9afb3-9cc4-4e10-a476-97f47608ed50
children.body:
I get the impression that a lot of people have only brought Lad Baby's Saugage Rolls For Everyone cause of the charity.
I'm pleased that people are giving money to charity and that's brilliant.
My point is a lot of people could of given the money to the charity direct instead of buying a song they don't buy cause they liked it.
People like me who loves music and cares about the charts have to suffer with these awful songs that are not worthy No1's.
People can click a down arrow, but it's true.

children.title: fd96756a-ee7d-49ce-b2bc-02758173edd8
children.body:
facts and facts only. the only good thing to come out of it is the money the two of them are raising for food banks across the uk, but can’t they just do something else?! especially when sausage rolls for everyone is this sh*te.

plus, people could always just make a fair donation to the food banks themselves instead of wasting 99p on a song they won’t unironically listen to.

this is turning into the x factor situation at this point. i hope to god there’s another campaign to block ladbaby for next year’s christmas number 1 like 2009. we defeated x factor back then. we will do the same to ladbaby.

children.title: b8af7be4-b355-4129-8e68-7a47a00522d2
children.body: Totally agree with you.

drupalComments.title: 93821567-2e2d-42cd-87be-30912caa43d0
drupalComments.body:
Hey all! first off, happy holidays 🥳
So yeah, the #1 is surely a big shocker for everyone here and I'm not the exception, but then again why why why did Elton John and Ed Sheeran record a xmas song together, like, what have I been missing⁉️ anyway, I'm glad to see Wham and Mariah once again in the top 5, and Adele scoring the xmas #1 album of the year is also quite pleasing. This week is not a big surprise ofc because it's that time of the year again and xmas songs are taking over as expected, but it's not a bad week at least so ig that's fine. Then again, I wish those of you who've helped me in the last 2 months a Merry Christmas and a happy new year! this *might* be the last time I'm in one of these disqus comment boxes so I wanted to stop by for a possible last time during the holidays. I'm still on discord/LFM for the real ones only, so if you'd like to chat I'll be there 😅 (though I'm not as active as I used to 😭)
Anyway, stream the future smash hit Can I Get It and all-time classic Hold My Hand... both outsold that godawful alphabet song with ease wbk 🤭
